channel.title: reading on Alok's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in reading on Alok's Blog

item.title: Paper Reading 3 pass
item.description: Reference: https://codearsonist.com/reading-for-programmers 3 pass Overview: Verify Value Background Grasp Thought Process Highlights Diagram Unknowns References Understand Holes Implementations Notes Process Verify This provides High level view of the contents. Start with references usually. Mark the cited papers I’ve read as to get previous notes I have made and verify the background. Title, Abstract, Introduction–> Read very carefully Scan through to find diagrams, equations.

item.title: Bibliography Management
item.description: What do the files mean? Here, I store all bibliography entries in article.bib , pdfs to pdfs folder, notes in articles.org file. That’s all there is to understand. (setq bibtex-completion-library-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/pdfs/" bibtex-completion-bibliography "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.bib" bibtex-completion-notes-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org" bibtex-completion-notes-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org") (setq org-ref-notes-directory "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/notes/" org-ref-bibliography-notes "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org" org-ref-default-bibliography '("c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.bib") org-ref-pdf-directory "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/pdfs") Using these files Adding entries: Find a paper, add it to aricles.bib. Either DOI or paper link. If pdf found by org-ref, okay.

item.title: Para
item.description: Projects Areas Resources Archives Projects Group of related task Specific outcomes Specific deadlines Areas No deadline Standards to be met e.g. House, Work etc. Resources Not tied to specific project but of interest to you e.g. Emacs, Productivity etc. Archives Inactive Projects, Areas or Resources. Archived
